text: This article lists the main sport climbing events and their results for 2017. ==World Cup== == World Championships == {| class="wikitable" !Date !Location !Competition !Discipline !Men !Women |- | rowspan="12" |August 30 – September 10 | rowspan="12" | Innsbruck | rowspan="12" |World Youth Championship |Junior Lead | Yoshiyuki Ogata | Claire Buhrfeind |- |Youth A Lead | Shuta Tanaka | Ashima Shiraishi |- |Youth B Lead | Colin Duffy | Ai Mori |- |Junior Speed | Carlos Granja | Daria Kan |- |Youth A Speed | Sergey Rukin | Aleksandra Kalucka |- |Youth B Speed | Jacopo Stefani | Polina Kulagina |- |Junior Bouldering | Yoshiyuki Ogata | Claire Buhrfeind |- |Youth A Bouldering | Filip Schenk | Ashima Shiraishi |- |Youth B Bouldering | Rei Kawamata | Futaba Ito |- |Junior Combined | Meichi Narasaki | Laura Stöckler |- |Youth A Combined | Sam Avezou | Sandra Lettner |- |Youth B Combined | Semen Ovchinnikov | Natsuki Tanii |} == Continental Championships == {| class="wikitable" |+ !Date !Location !Competition !Discipline !Men !Women |- | rowspan="2" |June 30 – July 1 | rowspan="2" | Campitello di Fassa | rowspan="2" |European Championships |Lead | Romain Desgranges | Anak Verhoeven |- |Speed | Marcin Dzienski | Iuliia Kaplina |- | rowspan="2" |August 18 – 19 | rowspan="2" | Munich | rowspan="2" |European Championships |Bouldering | Jan Hojer | Stasa Gejo |- |Combined | Jan Hojer | Janja Garnbret |- | rowspan="3" |September 18 – 21 | rowspan="3" | Tehran | rowspan="3" |Asian Championships |Bouldering | Kokoro Fujii | Akiyo Noguchi |- |Lead | Kokoro Fujii | Aya Onoe |- |Speed | Reza Alipourshena | Puji Lestari |} ==References== ==External links== * International Federation of Sport Climbing Website (IFSC) Category:Sport climbing Category:2017 in sports
